sentence.text: Morphologic features of MAPK cascade-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma may overlap with other uterine sarcoma types.
histone H2A monoubiquitination immunoexpression was studied in these tumors and their morphologic mimics to assess its diagnostic utility.

histone H2A monoubiquitination immunohistochemical staining was performed on archival tissue from 28 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas with classic morphology (20 MAPK cascade-NUTM2, 5 posttranscriptional regulation of gene expression-BCOR, 3 BCOR-ZC3H7B), 3 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas with unusual morphology and unknown gene rearrangement status, 66 low-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas, 21 endometrial stromal nodules, 38 uterine leiomyosarcomas, and 19 uterine leiomyomas.

Strong diffuse nuclear histone H2A monoubiquitination staining (defined as AAAA95% of tumor cells) was seen in the round cell component of all 20 (100%) classic MAPK cascade-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas and the 3 unusual high-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas which prompted superoxide metabolic process studies confirming MAPK cascade rearrangement in 2 tumors.

Diffuse histone H2A monoubiquitination staining was strong in three and weak in one histone H2A monoubiquitination-rearranged high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma while absent in the remaining four BCOR-rearranged tumors.

histone H2A monoubiquitination staining was weakly positive in AAAA5% of tumor cells in 4 of 66 (6%) low-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas and 1 of 18 (6%) endometrial stromal nodules and weakly to moderately positive in AAAA5-40% of tumor cells in 6 of 31 (19%) leiomyosarcomas.
No histone H2A monoubiquitination staining was seen in the remaining low-grade endometrial stromal sarcomas, endometrial stromal nodules, leiomyosarcomas, or any of the leiomyomas.

histone H2A monoubiquitination immunohistochemical staining is a highly sensitive marker for MAPK cascade-NUTM2 high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma with both classic and unusual morphology and identifies a subset of high-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma with BCOR alterations, including BCOR rearrangement and internal tandem duplication
